definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Every time we sit together talking, Ququ is open to speak his mind.
sentences.chinese: 每次我们坐在一起聊天的时候，蛐蛐总是畅所欲言。

sentences.english: B:Here they are, will you weigh all our luggage together?
sentences.chinese: 这些都是，要不要把我的全部行李一起过磅？

sentences.english: Lets go to the cinema together, and Ill call for you.
sentences.chinese: 咱们一起去看电影吧，到时候我来叫你。

sentences.english: The terminal is used in conjunction with a photographic typesetter.
sentences.chinese: 这种终端与照相排版机一起使用。

sentences.english: I think we should let Sylvia go camping with her boy-friend.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们应该让Sylvia和她男友一起去宿营。

sentences.english: It provides the opportunity to test unrelated applications running together.
sentences.chinese: 它提供了测试一起运行的无关应用程序的机会。

sentences.english: Cats and snakes are traditionally cooked together (in the south only), given the name "dragon tiger fight".
sentences.chinese: 猫和蛇通常一起做，名字叫“龙虎斗”。

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢和朋友们聚在一起，离开城市的喧嚣。

sentences.english: Shall we go through the drawings together?
sentences.chinese: 我们可以一起审阅这套设计图吗？

sentences.english: My father and mother, now together.
sentences.chinese: 我的阿爸，和阿妈，现在终于在一起了。
她还跟那个异教徒一起么？

sentences.english: We're gonna get together go to the wonderful light show on the mid-autumn day.
sentences.chinese: 在中秋那天夜晚，我们将一起去看灯会。

sentences.english: That's John. He lives with the Wang family.
sentences.chinese: 那是约翰，他和王家的人住一起。

sentences.english: A shop assistance hung it on a rack or placed it on a table with many others.
sentences.chinese: 店员把它挂到货架上，或与其它东西一起摆到桌子上。

sentences.english: Yesterday my brother and I went to catch crabs again.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我又和哥哥一起去捉螃蟹了。

sentences.english: The crew vehicle and the lander will then link up and fly off to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 然后载人飞行器和着陆器将连接到一起，并飞向月球。

definition: to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to go with sb/to form companionships
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
